title: Daniel Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Daniel with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 12 chapters.

questions.question: Who was the king of Judah when Nebuchadnezzar besieged Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: Daniel 1:1 states that in the third year of Jehoiakim king of Judah, Nebuchadnezzar came to Jerusalem and besieged it.

questions.question: What new names were given to Daniel and his three companions by the prince of the eunuchs?
questions.explanation: Daniel 1:7 records that Daniel was named Belteshazzar; Hananiah, Shadrach; Mishael, Meshach; and Azariah, Abednego.

questions.question: What diet did Daniel request in order to avoid defiling himself?
questions.explanation: Daniel 1:12 shows Daniel's request to be given pulse (vegetables) to eat and water to drink instead of the king's meat and wine.

questions.question: How long were Daniel and his companions nourished on the king's meat before standing before Nebuchadnezzar?
questions.explanation: Daniel 1:5 describes that they were nourished with the king's meat and wine for three years to stand before the king.

questions.question: True or False: Daniel was found to be wiser than all the magicians and astrologers in Nebuchadnezzar's kingdom.
questions.explanation: Daniel 1:20 states Daniel was found ten times better in wisdom and understanding than all the magicians and astrologers.

questions.question: What image did Nebuchadnezzar set up in the plain of Dura?
questions.explanation: Daniel 3:1 indicates that Nebuchadnezzar made an image of gold and set it up in the plain of Dura.

questions.question: What was the height of Nebuchadnezzar’s golden image?
questions.explanation: Daniel 3:1 specifies the height as threescore cubits (60 cubits).

questions.question: What were people commanded to do when they heard the sound of musical instruments at the dedication of the image?
options: Fall down and worship the golden image
questions.correctAnswer: Fall down and worship the golden image
questions.explanation: Daniel 3:5 commands all people to fall down and worship the golden image when the music plays.

questions.question: What punishment was decreed for those who refused to worship the golden image?
options: Cast into a burning fiery furnace
questions.correctAnswer: Cast into a burning fiery furnace
questions.explanation: Daniel 3:6 states that anyone not worshipping the image would be cast into a burning fiery furnace.

questions.question: Who were the three men thrown into the fiery furnace for not worshipping the image?
questions.explanation: Daniel 3:12 identifies these three Jews as Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego.

questions.question: True or False: The flames of the furnace harmed Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego in any way.
questions.explanation: Daniel 3:27 confirms that the fire had no power over them; not even a hair of their heads was singed.

questions.question: Who did Nebuchadnezzar see walking in the furnace with the three men?
options: A fourth like the Son of God
questions.correctAnswer: A fourth like the Son of God
questions.explanation: Daniel 3:25 states Nebuchadnezzar saw four men loose in the fire, and the fourth had the form like the Son of God.

questions.question: What was Nebuchadnezzar's reaction after the three men came out of the furnace?
options: He blessed the God of Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego
He commanded another image to be made
questions.correctAnswer: He blessed the God of Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego
questions.explanation: Daniel 3:28 shows Nebuchadnezzar praising the God who delivered the men.

questions.question: Who was the king that wrote the mysterious handwriting on the wall?
questions.explanation: Daniel 5:1 identifies Belshazzar as the king during the writing on the wall incident.

questions.question: What was Belshazzar doing when the fingers of a man's hand wrote on the wall?
options: Holding a great feast and drinking wine
questions.correctAnswer: Holding a great feast and drinking wine
questions.explanation: Daniel 5:1–2 describes Belshazzar's feast with wine and using the temple vessels.

questions.question: True or False: The king’s wise men were able to interpret the writing on the wall.
questions.explanation: Daniel 5:8 states that the wise men could neither read nor interpret the writing.

questions.question: Who was recommended to interpret the writing on the wall?
questions.explanation: Daniel 5:12 explains that Daniel was called because of his spirit and wisdom.

questions.question: What reward did Belshazzar promise to the one who could interpret the writing on the wall?
options: Clothed with scarlet, chain of gold about neck, third ruler in kingdom
The hand of his daughter in marriage
questions.correctAnswer: Clothed with scarlet, chain of gold about neck, third ruler in kingdom
questions.explanation: Daniel 5:7 promises this reward to the interpreter.

questions.question: True or False: Daniel was the third ruler in the kingdom of Babylon after interpreting the writing.
questions.explanation: Daniel 5:29 records Darius the Mede setting Daniel over the kingdom after the fall of Babylon.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'But the people that do know their God shall be strong, and do exploits.'
questions.explanation: Daniel 11:32 states the strong works of those who know their God.

questions.question: In Daniel 2, what did Nebuchadnezzar dream that Daniel interpreted?
options: A great image with various metals
Four beasts rising from the sea
questions.correctAnswer: A great image with various metals
questions.explanation: Daniel 2 describes the dream of a great statue with head of gold, chest of silver, etc.

questions.question: What does the head of gold represent in Nebuchadnezzar's dream?
questions.explanation: Daniel 2:38 clarifies the head of gold represents Nebuchadnezzar and his kingdom.

questions.question: True or False: The stone cut out without hands in Nebuchadnezzar’s dream represents the kingdom of God.
questions.explanation: Daniel 2:44 explains the stone represents God's everlasting kingdom.

questions.question: Which king experienced a period of insanity and lived like an animal for seven years?
questions.explanation: Daniel 4 recounts Nebuchadnezzar's madness and restoration.

questions.question: True or False: Daniel was thrown into the lion's den during Darius's reign.
questions.explanation: Daniel 6 describes Daniel in the lion's den under King Darius.

questions.question: What sealed the law that forbade prayer to anyone except King Darius for 30 days?
questions.explanation: Daniel 6:17 states the law was sealed with the king’s ring.

questions.question: Who informed King Darius about Daniel's continued prayer to God?
questions.explanation: Daniel 6:4 shows the princes and satraps sought to find grounds to accuse Daniel.

questions.question: What was Daniel's punishment for praying to God despite the king's decree?
questions.explanation: Daniel 6:16 details Daniel being cast into the lions' den.

questions.question: True or False: Daniel was unharmed in the lions' den because an angel shut the lions' mouths.
questions.explanation: Daniel 6:22 states God sent His angel to shut the lions' mouths.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Blessed be the name of God for ever and ever: for wisdom and might are his:'
questions.explanation: Daniel 2:20 contains this praise for God's wisdom and might.

questions.question: In Daniel’s vision of four beasts, what did the fourth beast have that was unique?
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:7 describes the fourth beast as dreadful with ten horns.

questions.question: Who is described as the 'Ancient of days' in Daniel's vision?
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:9-10 depicts the Ancient of days as the divine judge, God.

questions.question: True or False: The 'Son of man' in Daniel's vision is given everlasting dominion and glory.
questions.explanation: Daniel 7:14 explains that the Son of man is given everlasting dominion.

questions.question: Who was made ruler over the kingdom after Babylon fell, according to Daniel chapter 5?
questions.explanation: Daniel 5:31 states that Darius the Mede received the kingdom after Babylon's fall.

questions.question: Daniel was given the new Babylonian name 'Belteshazzar.' What does this indicate?
questions.explanation: Daniel 1:7 shows Daniel was given a Babylonian name to serve in the king's palace.

questions.question: True or False: Daniel’s three friends refused to bow to the golden image because they only worshipped their own God.
questions.explanation: Daniel 3:18 states these men would not worship any god except their own God.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'But they that shall be wise shall shine as the brightness of the ______.'
questions.explanation: Daniel 12:3 says the wise shall shine as the brightness of the firmament.

questions.question: What was Daniel's reaction when he saw the vision of the ram and goat?
options: He was troubled and sought understanding
He wrote a book about it
questions.correctAnswer: He was troubled and sought understanding
questions.explanation: Daniel 8:27 shows Daniel was troubled and sought understanding from God.

questions.question: Who is the 'little horn' that grows exceeding great in Daniel's vision?
questions.explanation: Daniel 8:23 describes the little horn as a king of fierce countenance.

questions.question: True or False: Daniel fasted and prayed for understanding about the end times described in his visions.
questions.explanation: Daniel 9:3-4 records Daniel praying and fasting for understanding.

questions.question: What was the purpose of Daniel’s prayer in chapter 9?
options: Confession and seeking God's mercy for Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Confession and seeking God's mercy for Israel
questions.explanation: Daniel 9:4-5 shows Daniel confessing Israel's sins and asking for mercy.

questions.question: Who appeared to Daniel to give the prophecy of the seventy weeks?
questions.explanation: Daniel 9:21-22 records Gabriel coming to Daniel with understanding.

questions.question: True or False: The seventy weeks prophecy relates to the coming of the Messiah and the end of transgression.
questions.explanation: Daniel 9:24 outlines the seventy weeks as a period to finish transgression and bring in everlasting righteousness.

questions.question: Who is described as the 'Prince of princes' in Daniel’s visions?
questions.explanation: Daniel 8:25 refers to a prince of princes who will be broken but not by human hand.

questions.question: What vision is described in Daniel chapter 10?
options: A glorious man clothed in linen
questions.correctAnswer: A glorious man clothed in linen
questions.explanation: Daniel 10:5-6 describes a man clothed in linen appearing to Daniel.
